name: underdog_value
applicable_to: underdog team with comeback ability + late scaling
reasoning: Market overvalues early game dominance
Late scaling + comeback history suggests underpriced
Best when market price < 0.35

name: trap_favorite
applicable_to: FADE favorite with high volatility + throw risk
reasoning: High WR teams with throw risk are overpriced by market
Volatility means unreliable despite record
Bet opponent when fav priced > 0.65

name: draft_edge_mixed_vs_ad
applicable_to: team with mixed damage vs all-AD opponent
reasoning: All-AD comps can be countered by armor stacking
Mixed damage is harder to itemize against
Draft advantage compounds over game length

name: early_snowball_closer
applicable_to: team that dominates early and closes fast
reasoning: Consistent early game + fast closing = reliable wins
Strong against teams without comeback ability
Best signal for live betting when team gets early lead

name: vision_control_edge
reasoning: Vision control enables picks and objective control
Often undervalued by public betting markets
Compounds with pick comp archetype

name: adc_lane_kingdom
applicable_to: team with ADC that dominates lane + deals high damage
reasoning: ADC lane dominance translates to dragon control
High DPM means the lead converts to team damage
Strongest in ADC-centric metas

name: stable_grinder
applicable_to: team that plays stable, slow games with teamfight comps
reasoning: Low variance = more predictable outcomes
Teamfight comps scale well into late game
Good for series bets (BO3/BO5) due to consistency

name: flex_draft_advantage
applicable_to: players who adapt builds/runes/skills across games
reasoning: Adaptability suggests better game understanding
Can adjust to opponent's draft/playstyle
Harder to prepare against in BO series

name: crossover_chaos_underdog
applicable_to: FADE when either team has chaotic crossover patterns (implies 50/50)
reasoning: Frequent lead changes = coin flip games
Back the underdog when game is chaotic
Market overprices favorites in volatile matchups

name: first_strike_tempo
applicable_to: player using First Strike with early item powerspike
reasoning: First Strike + early spike = gold acceleration
Tempo advantage compounds with team's early game
Strong when matched against scaling opponents
